text: hello this is Bill Cunningham from New
York and while a great blizzard of 2015
didn't materialize there was just enough
snow for the New Yorkers to venture out
Tuesday was a great snow day for the
kids in Central Park they were maybe
seven inches snow with the schools
closed and the subways closed and no
traffic no cars allowed in the city
everyone flocked to Central Park and of
course the kiddies in their bright
colored clothes are a delight I mean
it's just wonderful the few grown ups
that gradually moved around provided the
usual ballet of jumping over puddles but
one of the sweetest things I saw late in
the day a mother with a ten month old
baby wearing a little knitted cap that
looked like a radish tip upside down
with the green snow suit and they had a
little clear plastic bucket with a
string attached to it that they were
poor lighting the baby it I mean it was
absolutely just a delight absolutely
delight and then of course the little
doggies the city doggies with one here a
French Bulldog would look like he had
his pajamas on people have fun with it
all and fashion-wise the hood how people
survived without wearing them in the
1940s as I remember in the 30s it's
amazing because what a difference it
makes the jackets and coats with hoods
it's wonderful there was one young man a
typical braving it with a beautiful
double-breasted jacket but without
sleeves so she got me did they're just
so New York isn't it oh it's wonderful
and it was just absolutely marvelous and
there was a young man and he said he
came down from Harlem to Central Park
South and
made himself a snowman then he poured
himself a glass of wine and celebrated
his birthday in that one because all
these little traditions that people do
when it snows it's absolutely wonderful
Oh
